page.title: 13MY HOME _ BORTH
page.content: We came to live in our home in 1982. Before us, it was a holiday home. From our bedroom window we can see the church, cliff, beach, village and Borth bog, and opposite is the Youth Centre. There are six houses in our row, they are all now permanently lived in. Number 1 used to be a holiday home until last summer. When we look through our binoculars, we can see all the way down to Ynyslas and Aberdyfi. Dad has built a bird table in the corner of our garden, so we can watch the birds through our window. We put breadcrumbs, crushed biscuits and nuts for them to eat. The most common bird we see is the Blue Tit and the rarest bird we have seen was a Greenfinch. A black and white Wagtail comes sometimes.
